author: Megan Ellis
title: Ministers meet over visa laws
text:
Ministers meet over visa laws Article By: Megan Ellis Fri, 21 Aug 2015 7:28 AM Share Your Email A file image of passport stamps. Credit: Megan Ellis 
The Inter-Ministerial Committee (IMC) which is reviewing the visa regulations met on Thursday to discuss to consequences of the laws. 
The committee includes the ministers of Tourism, Home Affairs, Trade and Industry, Social Development and Small Business Development, as well as the security cluster. 
The IMC made a decision to establish a task team to review the visa laws. The task team will be led by Director-General in the Presidency Dr Cassius Lubisi. 
The task team will "consolidate and synthesise all proposals and to provide a composite set of recommendations to be tabled at the next IMC meeting in a fortnight", the Presidency said in a statement. Related Articles
